metadata.title: Appeals Bodies — Board of Examiners, Abatement Appeals Board, Access Appeals Commission, and Related Bodies
metadata.source: SF Building Inspection Commission Code (SFBICC), Sections 105A, 103A.4-5
notes: Three main appeals bodies: Board of Examiners, Abatement Appeals Board, Access Appeals Commission
Code Advisory Committee and Structural Advisory Committee are advisory, not appellate
Abatement Appeals Board IS the Building Inspection Commission (same 7 members)
Board of Examiners has 13 members including specialized seats
Access Appeals Commission has 5 members (2 disabled, 2 construction, 1 public)
Sections 103A.4 and 103A.5 cover vacant building registration obligations

board_of_examiners.title: Board of Examiners

specialized_members.qualification: Tenant who is a licensed architect/engineer
Property owner who is a licensed architect/engineer
Structural engineer specializing in seismic improvement

functions: Determine if new materials, methods, and types of construction meet code safety standards
Determine if variances from code requirements should be approved (unreasonable hardship)
Recommend reasonable code interpretations to the Building Official
Hear appeals from Abatement Orders involving construction methods or safety

authority_new_materials.description: When the Building Official denies approval of new materials/methods, the Board may determine if they comply with safety standards.
authority_new_materials.testing: Board adopts rules for examining and testing. Applicant bears all test and examination costs.
authority_new_materials.expert_consultation: Board may call upon experts at the applicant's expense.

authority_variances.description: Where new materials are not involved, the Board may consider variance applications.
authority_variances.standard: Variance will not result in a condition less safe or desirable from the viewpoint of public welfare.
authority_variances.effect: Upon Board recommendation, the Building Official shall approve the permit with any conditions the Board attaches.

board_of_examiners.filing_fee: Table 1A-K — Penalties, Hearings, Code Enforcement Assessments

abatement_appeals_board.title: Abatement Appeals Board

membership.identity: The seven members of the Building Inspection Commission

powers: Hear and decide appeals from Orders of Abatement after Building Official public hearing
Hear appeals regarding final bills for assessment of costs (upon showing substantial error)
May uphold, modify, or reverse orders to secure public health, safety, and welfare
abatement_appeals_board.jurisdiction_exception: Disabled access cases are heard by the Access Appeals Commission, not the Abatement Appeals Board.

hearing_process.scheduling: Within 10 days of filing, fix time and place for hearing (not more than 30 days after filing)
hearing_process.notice: Posted on property + served on appellant + transmitted to Building Official, at least 10 days before hearing
hearing_process.stay: Once an appeal is filed, the Building Official's order is stayed until a decision is rendered
hearing_process.continuance: One continuance for good cause, not to exceed 60 days
hearing_process.rehearing: Request must be made in writing within 10 days of the decision date

abatement_appeals_board.decision_timeline: Findings and decisions issued no later than 10 days after conclusion of hearing. Posted on property, served on appellant, and transmitted to Building Official within 5 days.
abatement_appeals_board.failure_to_appear: Building Official's order is immediately effective from the date it was issued (time under appeal not counted toward compliance).

life_safety_hazards.description: If the Board finds a serious and imminent hazard exists, work to correct must commence within 30 days and be completed within 90 days.
life_safety_hazards.non_hazard_violations: Work to repair must commence within 60 days and be completed within 18 months.

moratorium_financial_hardship.eligibility: Owner-occupant of a single- or two-family dwelling where all serious and imminent hazards have been corrected
moratorium_financial_hardship.applies_to: Conditions that are NOT serious and imminent hazards
moratorium_financial_hardship.decision_includes: Duration and conditions for termination, recorded in Assessor-Recorder's Office

moratorium_displacement.purpose: Prevent displacement of low and moderate income persons from affordable housing
conditions: Building Official's order issued after April 1, 1986
Not a serious/imminent hazard or life hazard
Does not violate Fire Code or any code other than Building Code and Housing Code
Does not endanger life, health, property, safety, or welfare
50% or more of households pay annual rent ≤ 30% of low/moderate income
Abatement would reasonably probably displace low/moderate income occupants
moratorium_displacement.extensions: Five-year extensions available upon written request and hearing
moratorium_displacement.rescission: Any person may request rescission via written request and hearing

abatement_appeals_board.failure_to_comply: Matter referred to City Attorney within 5 days for appropriate legal action.

access_appeals_commission.title: Access Appeals Commission
access_appeals_commission.authority: California Health and Safety Code Section 19957.5
powers: Hear written appeals on enforcement of California Health & Safety Code Part 5.5 (disability access)
Hear appeals on DBI enforcement of disability access and adaptability provisions
Approve or disapprove DBI interpretations and enforcement actions
access_appeals_commission.finality: Approvals or disapprovals are final and conclusive as to the Department, absent fraud or prejudicial abuse of discretion.
access_appeals_commission.filing: Written appeals filed with the Secretary of the Access Appeals Commission
access_appeals_commission.rehearing: Upon motion of a Commission member and affirmative vote of at least 3 members, within 10 days of the decision
access_appeals_commission.fee_waiver: Indigency declaration under penalty of perjury may exempt from filing fees
access_appeals_commission.fee_table: Table 1A-K — Penalties, Hearings, Code Enforcement Assessments
access_appeals_commission.notice_to_mayors_office: Materials for each matter sent to the Mayor's Office of Disability

code_advisory_committee.title: Code Advisory Committee
functions: Recommend which existing rules should remain, be modified, or canceled after new code adoption
Review and recommend on legislation proposed by Board of Supervisors
code_advisory_committee.meetings: At least once monthly, open to the public

structural_advisory_committee.title: Structural Advisory Committee

selection.member_3: Selected jointly by Building Official and owner

membership.qualification: Knowledgeable in structural engineering and construction issues presented by the special features

structural_advisory_committee.function: Advise the Building Official on buildings with special features or special design procedures. The engineer of record must demonstrate how structural concepts, designs, details, erection methods, and quality control will meet code intent.

applies_to: Northwest Mt. Sutro Slope Protection Area (Section 106A.4.1.3)
slope_protection_areas.modified_composition: Structural engineer + geologist + geotechnical engineer + consulting architect (voting member)
slope_protection_areas.modified_selection: Two members by Building Official/Public Works, one by Building Official and owner from neighborhood recommendations
slope_protection_areas.mandatory_denial: If the Committee determines reasonable likelihood of unsafe conditions or hillside instability that cannot be mitigated, the Building Official shall deny the permit. Appealable only to Board of Appeals.

building_inspection_commission_appellate.title: Appellate Authority of the Building Inspection Commission
building_inspection_commission_appellate.authority: SF Charter Section D3.750-4, implemented by Administrative Code Chapter 77

vacant_building_registration.title: Vacant or Abandoned Buildings — Annual Registration
definition_conditions: Unoccupied and secured by boarding or similar
Unoccupied and has multiple code violations
exceptions: Valid building permit for repair/construction with work completed within 1 year of permit issuance
Code compliant, not blighted, ready for occupancy, and actively listed for sale/lease/rent
Code compliant, not blighted, undergoing probate (up to 2 years)
vacant_building_registration.sign_posting: Name, address, phone of owner (and lender if in foreclosure). Minimum 8.5 x 11 inches, conspicuous protected location.

exterior: Structural integrity maintained (paint, foundation, roof, windows, etc.)
interior: Preserved from damage by elements or plumbing leaks
Free from garbage accumulation and pest infestation
maintenance_requirements.security: Secured against unauthorized entry, methods approved by the Director

vacant_building_registration.insurance: Fire and liability insurance as the Director determines necessary
vacant_building_registration.violation: Deemed a public nuisance, subject to enforcement under Sections 102A and 103A

vacant_commercial_storefronts.title: Vacant or Abandoned Commercial Storefronts — Annual Registration
vacant_commercial_storefronts.definition: Any area within a building that may be individually leased/rented for non-residential purpose, that has been unoccupied for over 30 days (or meets other vacancy criteria).
exceptions: Valid building permit with work completed within 1 year (extendable by Department)
Actively seeking required authorizations, permits, or licenses
Vacancy due to public infrastructure construction lasting over 30 days (180-day exemption, extendable)
vacant_commercial_storefronts.partial_refund: If rented and occupied before the registration payment deadline, up to half the fee refunded based on remaining days.
vacant_commercial_storefronts.annual_report: Licensed professional must confirm interior and exterior maintenance
vacant_commercial_storefronts.registry: Department maintains a registry, furnished quarterly to Office of Economic and Workforce Development
vacant_commercial_storefronts.penalty_for_failure_to_register: Table 1A-K — Failure to register vacant commercial storefront
